value.title: Trump campaign paid Dechert $164K for 'recount' related legal services, FEC filings show
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump's campaign last month paid more than $164,000 to Dechert, a law firm that during the 2020 election touted its work on pro bono voting rights cases in which it often faced off against Republican-backed lawyers.

value.title: President Trump’s niece, Mary Trump, says her ‘cruel and traitorous’ uncle belongs in prison
value.excerpt: Mary Trump rejects the notion that putting a former president on trial would deepen the nation’s political divisions.

value.title: Trump administration appoints loyalists Corey Lewandowski and David Bossie to Defense Business Board
value.excerpt: The Trump administration installed loyalists on a Pentagon advisory panel on Friday, naming Corey Lewandowski and David Bossie among the new appointees to the Defense Business Board. The appointments were announced along with the removal of other members,

value.title: Trump to award wrestling legend Dan Gable the Presidential Medal of Freedom
value.excerpt: President Trump will award Olympic gold medalist and college wrestling legend Dan Gable the Presidential Medal of Freedom on Monday.

value.title: Trump's grievances feed menacing undertow after the election
value.excerpt: "Death threats, physical threats, intimidation – it's too much, it's not right," said one GOP elections official in Georgia.

value.title: In race to cement legacy, Trump pushes dozens of 'midnight regulations'
value.excerpt: The Trump administration is quietly racing to solidify its legacy, fulfill campaign promises and overhaul federal regulations that could take Joe Biden years to undo.

value.title: Republican congressman tells Trump to 'delete your account' after he tweeted a 45-minute speech repeating baseless voter-fraud claims
value.excerpt: Republican Rep. Adam Kinzinger, who represents Illinois' 16th District, quote-tweeted Trump on Thursday.

value.title: Trump, Pence to campaign in Georgia as Senate runoff turnout concerns grow among GOP
value.excerpt: Mike Pence and President Donald Trump's rallies for Georgia's senators will be against a backdrop of growing concerns about GOP turnout in the Senate runoff election.

value.title: Dangerously viral: How Trump, supporters spread false claims
value.excerpt: It took just a day for a cellphone video of a man hauling a large box into a Detroit election office to be viewed more than a million times

value.title: DeSantis tells Trump to 'fight on,' takes aim at science and has beef with John Roberts
value.excerpt: Ron DeSantis on Thursday told a private gathering of political donors and corporate executives that he has urged President Donald Trump to “fight on" to overturn November’s election results. In wide-ranging remarks made in person behind closed doors at a meeting of the Associated Industries of Florida,

value.title: The Trump administration accused Facebook of reserving over 2,600 high-paying jobs for foreign workers instead of hiring Americans
value.excerpt: The DOJ's lawsuit alleges that Facebook discriminated against Americans and did not properly advertise the jobs to them before hiring foreign workers.

value.title: Trump Administration Claims Facebook Improperly Reserved Jobs for H-1B Workers
value.excerpt: A Justice Department lawsuit accuses the social-media company of illegally reserving high-paying jobs for immigrant workers it was sponsoring for permanent residence and failing to adequately search for U.

value.title: 'Simply unthinkable': Law officers call for halt to executions in Trump's final weeks
value.excerpt: Five executions are scheduled before Biden, who opposes capital punishment, takes office. Ninety current and former law officials want them to stop.

value.title: Trump campaign’s star witness in Michigan was deemed ‘not credible.’ Then, her loud testimony went viral.
value.excerpt: Even Giuliani reportedly made a point to note he had just met Melissa Carone, whose testimony drew comparisons to SNL sketches.

value.title: Trump lays out election-fraud case in online video: 'Bad things happened'
value.excerpt: Trump says if he's right about election fraud, 'Biden can't be president' President Trump is once again charging that last month’s presidential election was rigged and rife with fraud. In an address posted on his Twitter and Facebook pages that the president described as possibly “the most important speech,

value.title: Trump Hints at Another Act in Four Years, Just Like Grover Cleveland
value.excerpt: The president is eying a comeback in 2024 aimed at making him the only person other than Cleveland to win another term after losing the White House.

value.title: Republican U.S. lawmakers may defy Trump over defense bill veto threat
value.excerpt: The chairman of the U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee and some other Republican lawmakers pushed back on Wednesday against President Donald Trump's threat to veto a massive defense bill unless it eliminates a federal law protecting tech companies.

value.title: Trump backs McConnell's Republican COVID-19 relief package: Mnuchin
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump will sign coronavirus relief legislation proposed by Republican Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told reporters on Wednesday, should the proposed package pass the U.

value.title: John Mulaney says he was investigated by the Secret Service over joke 'that was not about Donald Trump'
value.excerpt: John Mulaney says he was investigated by the Secret Service after making a joke that many believed was a threat against President Donald Trump.

value.title: Wisconsin governor: Trump election lawsuit an 'assault on democracy'
value.excerpt: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers (D) criticized President Trump’s latest lawsuit seeking to overturn the state's election results as an “assault on democracy.”

value.title: ‘This is reality’: Renown doctor in Trump hospital garage retweet refutes fake claims
value.excerpt: Dr. Jacob Keeperman never expected his tweet to blow up on social media after it got hijacked by President Donald Trump.

value.title: Trump's former campaign manager Brad Parscale said he planned to capitalize on baseless fears about mass voter fraud
value.excerpt: Trump has relentlessly spread false claims and conspiracy theories about mass voter fraud committed by Democrats.

value.title: In new interview, Mueller talks about Vietnam, but not Trump and Russia
value.excerpt: Mueller spoke to Chuck Rosenberg for the NBC News podcast The Oath. In the interview, Mueller seems more in command than when he spoke to Congress in 2019.

value.title: Trump is leaving Washington as he governed — chaotically
value.excerpt: First Read is your briefing from "Meet the Press" and the NBC Political Unit on the day's most important political stories and why they matter.

value.title: As Trump Rages, Voters in a Key County Move On: ‘I’m Not Sweating It’
value.excerpt: Pre-election tensions ran high in Bucks County, Pa. But Biden supporters there are increasingly comfortable tuning President Trump out and moving on, with an eye toward January.

value.title: Trump Threatens to Veto Defense Bill if Tech Liability Shield Stands
value.excerpt: The president is demanding the termination of the broad legal immunity that social-media companies enjoy.

value.title: While Cuban-Americans in Florida came out big for Trump, Cubans stuck in Mexico pinned their hopes on Biden
value.excerpt: "I will remain hoping for a change. I'm glad Trump is out for good, and no thanks to my family in Florida," a Cuban doctor in Mexico told Insider.

value.title: Donald Trump suggests 2024 presidential bid: 'I'll see you in four years'
value.excerpt: President makes comments to Republicans at a White House reception, where video shows dozens of people crammed together without masks

value.title: Banished from the Trump legal team, attorney Sidney Powell still finds a guest chair on Fox

value.title: The Daily 202: Ousted U.S. attorney, removed by Barr as he investigated Trump associates, lands new job
value.excerpt: During a noon meeting in a suite at the Pierre hotel in Manhattan on a Friday in June, Attorney General Bill Barr pressured Geoffrey Berman to step aside as the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York.
